intro: Grammitis percrassa, commonly known as the broad-leaf moss or giant moss, is a member of the family Hypnaceae. It is a non-vascular plant characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth habit and dark green, leathery leaves. The leaves are typically elongated and have a distinct midrib, which is a key identifying feature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Grammitis percrassa plays an important ecological role in maintaining soil stability and moisture retention in its habitat.
